description.value:
Totem of Cockroach

Totem Spirit (Wisdom) — Creation Cost: 6 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Survival / Adaptation / Persistence

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Cockroach, the pack must confront a spirit that embodies endurance beyond reason and survival after ruin. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Scavenger-Endurance Spirit (Cockroach Aspect) — Suggested base: Spirit-empowered monstrosity or aberration (CR 8–9), resilient, evasive, and difficult to destroy
  • Aftermath Survivor Spirit — Suggested base: Oinoloth- or yugoloth-style stat block (CR 8–10), stripped of fiendish allegiance and treated as a spirit of endurance through collapse
  • Plague-Hardened Swarm-Mind Spirit — Suggested base: Single-entity swarm construct (CR 9–11), immune to fear effects and resistant to environmental hazards

These spirits rarely demand combat. They test the pack's ability to adapt, ration, and persist under hostile conditions.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on saving throws against poison and disease
  • You have advantage on Constitution saving throws made to resist environmental effects (extreme heat or cold, suffocation, forced marches)
  • Once per long rest, when you would gain a level of exhaustion, you may ignore that level

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Cockroach's endurance.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members have advantage on Constitution saving throws
  • Pack members ignore the effects of difficult terrain caused by rubble, debris, filth, or environmental ruin
  • Once during the duration, when a pack member would drop to 0 hit points, they may instead drop to 1 hit point and gain one level of exhaustion

This represents Cockroach's creed: survival now, recovery later.

Ban — Endure, Do Not Waste

Cockroach demands endurance through prudence.

The pack must not waste vital resources, abandon preparation, or court unnecessary danger when caution and adaptation are reasonably possible.

If the pack repeatedly squanders supplies, ignores warnings, or embraces avoidable destruction, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Cockroach may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
